nodes.bodyText:
our convention has been for the package name to be the module name minus the dashes and minus the version
i'm good with having a special case for spring (making this change), since we have many different spring modules (and growing), and this does look nicer
can you submit a follow-up PR to change this in the other spring auto modules so that we adopt this new spring module naming consistently?
I'll make this my next change
maybe add a comment about alternatively using otlp, jaeger or zipkin exporter here (and in the other PRs), since that's what most people will be doing
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,87 @@
+# Manual Instrumentation for Spring-WebFlux
+
+Provides OpenTelemetry instrumentation for Spring's WebClient.
+
+## Quickstart
+
+### Add these dependencies to your project.
+
+Replace `SPRING_VERSION` with the version of spring you're using.
+`Minimum version: 5.0`
+
+Replace `OPENTELEMETRY_VERSION` with the latest stable [release](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.opentelemetry).
+`Minimum version: 0.8.0`
+
+For Maven add to your `pom.xml`:
+```xml
+<dependencies>
+  <!-- opentelemetry -->
+  <dependency>
+    <groupId>io.opentelemetry.instrumentation</groupId>
+    <artifactId>opentelemetry-spring-webflux-5.0</artifactId>
+    <version>OPENTELEMETRY_VERSION</version>
+  </dependency>
+
+   <!-- provides opentelemetry-sdk -->
+   <dependency>
+    <groupId>io.opentelemetry</groupId>
+    <artifactId>opentelemetry-exporters-logging</artifactId>

nodes.bodyText:
i'm not sure we need to include note about providing the opentelemetry-sdk, i like the message of "use the OpenTelemetry API and/or use OpenTelemetry library instrumentation, then add an exporter, and you are good to go".
i think that's the message we agreed on in #846, but it would be good to get @anuraaga's thoughts here also
users don't need to care about the sdk, they just use API and add an exporter, and

               <!-- provides opentelemetry-sdk -->
          
          
            
               <!-- opentelemetry exporter -->

nodes.bodyText: i think copy same comments from pom above into gradle below, since gradle users will probably just skip the above section
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,87 @@
+# Manual Instrumentation for Spring-WebFlux
+
+Provides OpenTelemetry instrumentation for Spring's WebClient.
+
+## Quickstart
+
+### Add these dependencies to your project.
+
+Replace `SPRING_VERSION` with the version of spring you're using.
+`Minimum version: 5.0`
+
+Replace `OPENTELEMETRY_VERSION` with the latest stable [release](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/io.opentelemetry).
+`Minimum version: 0.8.0`
+
+For Maven add to your `pom.xml`:
+```xml
+<dependencies>
+  <!-- opentelemetry -->
+  <dependency>
+    <groupId>io.opentelemetry.instrumentation</groupId>
+    <artifactId>opentelemetry-spring-webflux-5.0</artifactId>
+    <version>OPENTELEMETRY_VERSION</version>
+  </dependency>
+
+   <!-- provides opentelemetry-sdk -->
+   <dependency>
+    <groupId>io.opentelemetry</groupId>
+    <artifactId>opentelemetry-exporters-logging</artifactId>
+    <version>OPENTELEMETRY_VERSION</version>
+  </dependency>
+
+  <!-- required to instrument spring-webflux -->
+  <!-- this artifact should already be present in your application -->
+  <dependency>
+    <groupId>org.springframework</groupId>
+    <artifactId>spring-webflux</artifactId>
+    <version>SPRING_VERSION</version>
+  </dependency>
+
+</dependencies>
+```
+
+For Gradle add to your dependencies:
